intro: Tetragonia distorta, commonly known as the twisted purslane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are fleshy and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months.
